definition: to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: In polished white mansion of stone, Maggie.
sentences.chinese: 在青春歡樂盛裝的上光白石華屋中。

sentences.english: Men, women and children are put on the family holiday attire, followed by the seated position in the family hierarchy.
sentences.chinese: 全家男女老少都穿上節日的盛裝，按輩分依次坐定。

sentences.english: Sometimes they are talented at music or singing, and often dress well.
sentences.chinese: 他們常會在音樂盒歌唱方面有天賦，總喜歡盛裝打扮。

sentences.english: Mary was diked out in her Sunday best.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗身着盛裝，打扮得漂漂亮亮。

sentences.english: On Christmas all the girls in the village are rigged out in their best clothes.
sentences.chinese: 聖誕節那一天，村裏的姑娘們都盛裝打扮起來。

sentences.english: People rarely dress up when they go out to vote.
sentences.chinese: 差不多沒人會爲了去投票而盛裝打扮。

sentences.english: The whole family were dressed up to the nines when they left for the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都身著盛裝去參加婚禮。

sentences.english: It can take us through the full panoply of human emotions within one particular composition.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們在一首曲子中經歷人類所有情感的的盛裝聚會。

sentences.english: But it is all a grandiose pageant.
sentences.chinese: 但素有這些這都是一種浮誇的盛裝遊行。

sentences.english: Children often hang up stockings to fill with small gifts.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們常常掛起長統襪用來盛裝小禮物。

sentences.english: They were all decked out in their Sunday best.
sentences.chinese: 他們着意打扮，穿上了節日盛裝。

sentences.english: You need a wardrobe of bras to avoid a panic situation when you’re getting dressed .
sentences.chinese: 你需要一衣櫥的文胸以避免盛裝時出現驚惶的情況。

sentences.english: Girls in holiday dress dance to the accompaniment of drums.
sentences.chinese: 姑娘們身着節日盛裝，應着木鼓鼓點翩翩起舞。

sentences.english: People are using Halloween to pay homage to Michael Jackson.
sentences.chinese: 人們也用萬聖節盛裝向邁克爾傑克遜致敬。

sentences.english: She came out of her room equipped for the ball.
sentences.chinese: 她盛裝從房裏出來預備到跳舞會去。

definition: ceremonial robe/formal attire (dinner suit, evening gown etc)
to get together all at once
to arrange/to set out/to decorate/to display/decorative items
